conclusion: For an ideal gas, any state satisfies the ideal-gas relation P V = n R T, where n R is constant for the fixed mass of gas in this cycle.
State A: P₁V₁ = n R T₀.
State C lies directly above D on the diagram, so the pressure at C is P₂ and the volume is V₂.

premise: State C: P₂V₂ = n R T_C.
conclusion: Applying the ideal-gas relation at C: P₂V₂ = n R T_C.

premise: State A: P₁V₁ = n R T₀ and State C: P₂V₂ = n R T_C.
conclusion: Divide the equation for state C by that for state A to eliminate n R: (P₂V₂) / (P₁V₁) = T_C / T₀.
Solve for T_C: T_C = T₀ • (P₂ / P₁) • (V₂ / V₁).
